subject: polity
title: Parliamentary Devices & Procedures
description: Key parliamentary devices including Sessions, Quorum, Question Hour, Zero Hour, Motions, and Special Procedures used in Indian Parliament

rows.timing:
**3 sessions per year:**
• Budget Session (Feb-May)
• Monsoon Session (Jul-Sep)
• Winter Session (Nov-Dec)
rows.features:
• Gap between sessions ≤ 6 months (Art 85)
• President summons Parliament (Art 85(1))
• Session ends by prorogation
rows.purpose: Constitutional obligation to meet thrice yearly; Ensures continuous oversight of government
rows.examPoints: Art 85 - Max 6 months gap crucial; President summons on PM's advice; Both Houses prorogued simultaneously

rows.features:
• **1/10th of total members**
• LS: 55 members (543/10)
• RS: 25 members (245/10)
• Including Presiding Officer
rows.purpose: Ensures minimum attendance for valid proceedings; If no quorum, House adjourned till quorum present
rows.examPoints: Art 100(3) - 1/10th members; If pointed out, Speaker counts; If no quorum, House adjourned; Often misused to stall proceedings

rows.timing:
**First hour of sitting**
11 AM - 12 PM
(Monday to Friday)
rows.features:
• **Starred Questions**: Oral answer + supplementary questions (distinguished by *)
• **Unstarred Questions**: Written answer only
• **Short Notice Questions**: <10 days notice on urgent public importance
rows.purpose: Most important device for executive accountability; Ministers answer questions on government policies/actions
rows.examPoints: NOT mentioned in Constitution (Rules of Procedure); Starred vs Unstarred crucial; Can skip if urgent govt business

rows.timing:
**12 PM - 1 PM**
Immediately after Question Hour
rows.features:
• **Not in Rules** (convention since 1962)
• Members raise matters without prior notice
• No formal debate/voting
• Speaker's discretion
rows.purpose: Allows members to raise urgent public issues; Flexible device for raising diverse matters
rows.examPoints: NOT in Constitution/Rules; Indian innovation; No voting; Matters of urgent public importance; Speaker controls

rows.features:
• **Adjournment Motion**: Urgent, definite matter of public importance; Censures govt
• **No-confidence Motion** (Art 75(3)): Only LS; 50 members support needed
• **Censure Motion**: Disapproval of govt policy
• **Cut Motions**: On budget demands (Policy/Economy/Token)
rows.purpose: Key tools for opposition to criticize government; No-confidence can topple government
rows.examPoints: Adjournment = Censure govt; No-confidence only in LS (50 MPs); Censure = less severe; Cut motions during budget

rows.features:
• **Rule violation** pointed out
• Must cite specific rule
• Speaker's decision final (Art 122(1))
• No debate on Point of Order
rows.purpose: Ensures procedural regularity; Protects parliamentary rules; Members can raise immediately if rules violated
rows.examPoints: Based on Rules of Procedure; Speaker decides (Art 122 - Courts can't interfere); Must cite rule number; No debate

rows.timing:
**End of Question Hour**
Before main business
rows.features:
• **Urgent matter** of sufficient importance
• No prior notice debate
• Member makes statement (5 min)
• No debate/voting
rows.purpose: Allows raising important issues without full debate; Quicker than regular motions
rows.examPoints: Under LS Rule 377 (RS has similar provision); No debate; 5-min statement; Published in proceedings

rows.features:
• **Private Member's Resolution**: By non-minister (Friday)
• **Government Resolution**: By minister (anytime)
• **Substantive Motion**: Self-contained proposal
• Requires debate & voting
rows.purpose: Express opinion of House; Can be on any matter of general public interest; Not binding on govt (unlike bills)
rows.examPoints: Private members' day = Friday; Govt resolutions binding on govt; Can be on any topic; Voted upon

rows.features:
• **Follow-up** to starred question
• Notice of 3 days
• Max 30 minutes
• Detailed discussion on answer given
rows.purpose: Deeper examination of issues raised in Question Hour; Seeks clarification/additional info
rows.examPoints: NOT in Constitution; Procedural device; 3 days notice; Only on starred question answer; 30 min max

rows.timing:
**2.5 hours**
Scheduled by Business Advisory Committee
rows.features:
• **Urgent public importance** matter
• 10 days notice
• No voting at end
• Also called '2.5 hour discussion'
rows.purpose: Discuss important issues without voting; Allows detailed debate on contemporary issues
rows.examPoints: LS Rule 193; 2.5 hours; No voting; 10 days notice; Any urgent public importance matter

notes: **Constitutional vs Procedural**: Only Quorum (Art 100(3)) is in Constitution; Others are in Rules of Procedure & Conduct of Business
**Question Hour Importance**: Most effective tool for executive accountability; Ministers must answer; Can lead to debates
**Zero Hour Uniqueness**: Indian parliamentary innovation (1962); Not found in British Parliament; Most flexible device
**Motions for Control**: Adjournment (censures govt), No-confidence (only LS, can topple govt), Censure (disapproval), Cut (budget reduction)
**Speaker's Power**: Final authority on Point of Order, admitting motions, allowing special mentions; Art 122(1) prevents judicial review of proceedings
**Art 105**: Powers, privileges, immunities of Parliament and members - Freedom of speech (can't be prosecuted for anything said in House)
**Comparison**: Question Hour (1st hour, oral questions) vs Zero Hour (2nd hour, no rules, urgent matters) vs Special Mention (Rule 377, no debate)
examTips: Remember **timing**: Question Hour (11 AM-12 PM), Zero Hour (12 PM-1 PM), Half-hour discussion (after QH)
**Only Quorum (Art 100(3)) is Constitutional**; Rest are in Rules of Procedure
**Starred vs Unstarred**: Starred (*) = Oral + Supplementary; Unstarred = Written only
**Motions distinction**: Adjournment (censure + adjourn House), No-confidence (only LS, 50 support), Censure (disapproval), Cut (budget)
**Zero Hour** is Indian innovation (not in UK Parliament); Most flexible device
**Point of Order**: Must cite rule; Speaker's decision final; Art 122(1) prevents judicial review
**Rule 377 (Special Mention)** vs **Rule 193 (Short Duration Discussion)**: 377 = No debate, 5 min; 193 = 2.5 hours, no voting
